Dear Mr. Johnson:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code ACT 116 - 722.120
Title
Rule Code & ACT 116 - 722.120 Investigation, inspection, and examination of
Section conditions, books, records, and reports; access by department,
Description bureau of fire services, or local authorities; records; reports report;
forms; confidentiality; disclosure of information; availability of
confidential records; child information cards to be provided to
department; failure of licensee to cooperation with investigation,
inspection or examination.
(1) The department may investigate, inspect, and examine conditions
of a childcare organization and may investigate and examine the
books and records of the licensee. The licensee shall cooperate with
the department’s investigation, inspection, and examination by doing
all of the following:
(c) Providing accurate and truthful information to the department, and
encouraging witnesses, such as staff and household members, to
provide accurate and truthful information to the department.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are concerns of staff asking another staff to falsify bed
checks.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source was interviewed via phone on March 14, 2024
and had no further complaints.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on March 14, 2024. Staff 1
reported there have been some issues at the facility since Staff 2
was hired as a team lead. Within the team lead role, that person
oversees how the shift is run. He reported on February 1, 2024, that
there were a lot of things going on within the unit, such as new
intakes of youth and other youth requesting items. Staff 1 reported
one of the new youths was getting upset because they wanted to
make a phone call, but he did not have the appropriate items to allow
that to happen. He reported when Staff 2 came to the home, she
asked him “Why did you do so many room checks at the fifteen-
minute mark?” Staff 1 proceeded to explain to Staff 2 that he had
been busy and was not able to adhere to varying interval checks not
2

exceeding fifteen minutes. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 told him, “Well go
back and change the times since you were maintaining supervisor” to
which Staff 1 declined as those checks were done at specific times
since the youth were in specific places at those moments and not in
the line of sight. Staff 1 reported he felt uncomfortable that Staff 2
told him to falsify the documentation. He reported he did not end up
changing his documentation. Staff 1 reported he had been told by
Staff 4 that Staff 2 had also told him to falsify documentation.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 15,
2024. Staff 2 reported she is a lead worker at the facility and her role
is to make sure the shift runs smoothly, and everything is being done
correctly. She reported one of her roles is to look over the
documentation staff completes. Staff 2 reported staff maintains eyes
on supervision of the youth when they are not in bedrooms or
bathroom. She stated staff document the eyes on supervision. Staff 2
reported if a youth goes into their bedroom or bathroom, staff are to
perform variable interval checks of the youth not to exceed fifteen
minutes. She was asked if she ever asked staff to change their
documentation or personally changed the documentation when it was
not correct. Staff 2 responded she would never do that. She asked
why she would do that when she knows the cameras are always
being viewed and that would be falsifying the documentation. She
also reported she has never asked a staff to change her
documentation after her shift. When asked why someone would say
that she has, Staff 2 responded there was a day when she reviewed
Staff 1’s documentation and asked him why he was doing room
checks every fifteen minutes instead of variable interval times, and
Staff 1 told her because that is how it supposed to be done. She
reported she talked with Supervisor about this situation and Staff 1
told Supervisor he asked her to change the times. Staff 2 reported
she never told him to change the times and told him in the future he
needs to do variable intervals checks.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
15, 2024. Supervisor reported Staff 2 spoke to him about the bed
check logs to make sure it was being completed correctly. He
reported Staff 2 stated she had spoken with Staff 1 about making
sure it was being done correctly, meaning the room checks needed
to be completed within variable intervals not to exceed fifteen
minutes, and believed Staff 1 took it as her telling him to falsify the
documentation. Supervisor reported he spoke with Staff 1 about the
situation as well and he reported Staff 2 was asking him to change
the documentation. Supervisor reported he believed it was a
misunderstanding. He reported he offered to set up a meeting
between Staff 1 and Staff 2 about the situation and Staff 1 declined
the offer. Supervisor reported he does not have concerns of staff
falsifying documentation.
3

Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 15,
2024. Staff 4 reported sometimes he covers team lead third shifts.
He reported about two weeks ago he came onto his shift and began
to complete his room checks, which are noted to be variable intervals
not to exceed fifteen minutes. Staff 4 reported he received a phone
call from Staff 2 asking if he could look over her documentation of
safety checks she did the shift earlier. He reported when he reviewed
it, he saw there was a half hour of no documentation, and she asked
him to write “remain in supervision.” Staff 4 reported he did not
change the documentation as he was not there and did not want to
falsify the documentation. He reported they are trained to document
what they do and see.
Staff 7 was interviewed via phone on March 18, 2024. Staff 7
reported he has concerns about Staff 2 forging documentation at the
facility. He reported on March 9, 2024, the staff took all the youth on
an outing and returned home around 7pm. Staff 7 reported at the end
of the shift, Staff 8 showed the fifteen-minute check log and it
appeared someone had forged Staff 8’s name on the checks. Staff 7
reported Staff 8 told him; that Staff 2 had confronted her about her
checks not being done timely and when Staff 8 was ending her shift
she looked at the form and believed Staff 2 corrected it by using her
name. Staff 7 does not believe Staff 2 has ever changed his
documentation but notes he may just be unaware.
Staff 8 was interviewed via phone on March 18, 2024. Staff 8
reported she worked on March 9, 2024 and was in charge of the
documentation for the checks of youth when they got back to the
facility around 7pm. She reported the checks are documented every
fifteen minutes when you have eyes on the youth and in variable
intervals when you are doing room checks. Staff 8 reported Staff 2
reviewed her documentation and asked her to add a line in for a
check. She reported she did not add in that line as requested
because she did not do a check at that time. Staff 8 reported later in
the shift she looked at the documentation and saw there was a line
written with her initials in it that she did not add. She reported this
was also not in her handwriting as she always writes in a bigger font
with the majority of uppercase letters whereas this line was in a
smaller font with lowercase letters. Staff 8 reported she believed it
was Staff 2 that did this as she was the one to talk to her about
adding that line.
Staff 10 was interviewed via phone on March 20, 2024. Staff 10
reported she worked on March 9, 2024 and was completing interval
checks and documentation prior to Staff 8 completing them. She
reported she was never told to falsify any of the times or her
documentation. Staff 10 reported she would never sign someone
4

else’s initials to the paperwork even if she witnesses them doing the
room check. She reported it is on the staff that did the verification
check to complete the documentation.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 15,
2024. Staff 3 was asked about when checks need to be documented
on youth at the facility. He reported checks need to be always
completed on the youth. Staff 3 reported if a youth goes into their
room or out of sight of staff then staff need to perform room checks in
variable intervals not exceeding fifteen minutes. He reported he was
never asked to change any of his documentation and has never seen
someone change the documentation.
Staff 5 and Staff 6 were separately interviewed face to face at
the facility on March 15, 2024. Staff 5 and Staff 6 reported they
have never been asked to falsify any documentation and denied
every falsifying documentation. They reported they have been trained
to document every time they complete a fifteen-minute check or room
check in variable intervals not exceeding fifteen minutes. Staff 5 and
Staff 6 reported if they are to miss a room check in the time required,
they are to do a room check right away and not falsify the time.
Documentation Reviewed:
- Facility Daily Shift Log dated February 1, 2024 - Staff 1
reported there was room checks he completed every fifteen
minutes and was asked to change by Staff 2. When reviewing
the document Staff 1 wrote he completed bed checks at
5:45pm, 6:00pm, 6:15pm, 6:30pm, 6:45pm and 7:00pm. The
other bed checks he completed were done in variable
intervals that did not exceed fifteen minutes.
- Video Review House 1 on February 1, 2024 from 5:30pm
to 7:00pm- Video footage was reviewed to compare the
documentation on the Daily Shift Log to when Staff 1
completed the room checks. When reviewing the video Staff 1
completed room checks at 5:38pm, 5:48pm, 6:01-6:30pm,
6:08pm, 6:17pm-6:18pm, 6:21pm, 6:23pm, 6:30pm, 6:34pm,
6:42pm, 6:45pm, and 6:53pm. This was completed in
compliance with the rule for checking on youth when not in
direct eyesight. Staff 1 was also viewed in the video to be
completing intake paperwork for new youth coming to the
facility which may have led to him not documenting the correct
times on the Daily Shift Log.
- Facility Daily Shift Log dated February 24, 2024- Staff 4
reported when he was working third shift, he was asked by
Staff 2 to check if there was any time missing within the Daily
Shift Log. He reported there was a half hour of time missing,
5

and Staff 2 asked him to correct it. When reviewing the
physical Daily Shift Log from February 24, 2024, there was
checks completed at 4:33pm, 5:00pm, 6:20pm, and 6:50pm
that fit the concern Staff 4 mentioned. It is noted on the sheet
that the youth were outside and on a van trip during that time
which remained in direct supervision of staff.
- Facility Daily Shift Log dated March 9, 2024- Staff 8
reported concerns of someone writing in her signature on the
shift log for 03/09/2024. When reviewing the documentation,
the check that is at 7:53pm has the initials of Staff 8
completing but the handwriting does look different than the
other checks Staff 8 documented at 8:07pm, 8:17pm, and
8:30pm. Staff 10 and Staff 2 completed the Daily Shift Log
checks prior to the 7:53pm check.
- Video Review House 1 on March 9, 2024 from 7:45pm to
8:30pm- Staff 8 is observed completing the check at 7:53pm
which is consistent with the Daily Shift Log, even though there
is concern that the handwriting is not similar. Within the video,
Staff 8 is seen writing on paperwork. Staff 8 also completed
the checks at 8:07pm, 08:17pm, and 8:30pm which is
consistent with the Daily Shift Log.
- Facility Policy and Procedure for Supervision of Minors in
Residential Placement dated July 2022- This policy notes it
is not acceptable to record or sign off on a check if it was not
completed or before it has been completed. The facility notes
this as falsified documentation and could lead to termination
of employment.
- Staff 2’s Human Resource File- On February 7, 2024,
Supervisor spoke with Staff 2 about the reported concerns of
falsifying documentation. Staff 2 reported to Supervisor she
would have never told staff to change the documentation, only
that staff should in the future stagger the checks and not
perform them at exactly 15 minutes. There were no
disciplinary actions taken from that meeting. Staff 2 is up to
date on all required trainings. She was trained on
documentation requirements on November 16, 2023.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as Staff 1 falsified the
daily shift log noting he performed checks every minute opposed
to the time he actually completed the checks as observed on
video.
Technical Assistance:
Technical assistance was offered to ensure the daily shift log and
supervision policy don’t contradict. The daily shift log states
6

throughout each shift staff are to complete varying interval checks
not to exceed fifteen minutes, whereas the policy states
throughout each shift staff are to complete fifteen minute checks.
Consultation:
Consultation was offered to consider the documentation
requirements when youth are within the direct supervision of staff.
Currently staff are made to document every fifteen minutes for
each youth even if they are sitting next to the youth for a long
period of time which impacts the staff’s ability to engage with
youth.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Staff to resident ratio
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-child
Description ratio formula for direct care workers. If a child caring institution is
contracted by the department to care for youth, the facility will
follow its contracted ratio.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency was out of ratio on at least two occasions.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source was interviewed via phone on March 14, 2024
and had no further complaints.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on March 14, 2024. Staff 1
reported on February 15, 2024 around 10:45pm, Staff 2 came onto
the unit and gave the directions for staff to step out of ratio to help
her take the recycling out. He reported there were either ten or
eleven youths on the unit at the time when he and Staff 3 were
working. Staff 1 reported the ratio is one staff to every eight youth, so
completing the task Staff 2 told them to do would put them out of the
ratio. He reported Staff 3 did follow the direction of Staff 2 because
she would have reprimanded him. Staff 1 reported he was left out of
the ratio for a bit of time. Staff 1 reported on February 21, 2024
around 5pm, Staff 2 was working with him on shift. He reported Staff
2 left the house both days which left him to be out of ratio with the
youth. Staff 1 reported it was told to him it would be fine because
Supervisor was asking for Staff 2 to come to another home.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 15,
2024. Staff 2 reported that being a lead worker gives her the ability to
float between the houses to help where there is a need. She reported
the ratio during the awake hours is one staff to every eight youth and
7

during sleeping hours the ratio is one staff to every twelve youth. She
reported each house during awake hours is staffed with two staff and
when they need a filler within the ratio, she will fill in. She stated on
weeknights youth go to bed around 9:30pm and on weekends they
go to bed around 10:30pm. Staff 2 reported she remembers only one
time, but could not recall the specific date, where a staff had called
off last minute. She had to fill in as the staff to meet ratio while
Supervisor worked on getting another staff to come in. Staff 2
reported she never asked to have staff step out of ratio or told them it
would be all right to be out of ratio for a few moments. When asked
about the recycling incident she reported she never asked for Staff 3
to step out of ratio since the youth were all sleeping, and Staff 1
would be in ratio in the home.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 15,
2024. Staff 3 reported the ratio at the facility when the youth are
awake is one staff to every eight youth. He reported he does not
know the nighttime ratio. Staff 3 reported there was one occasion
when he was asked by Staff 2 to step out of ratio. He reported he
was working with Staff 1, and they had eleven youth within the home,
so they were in the exact ratio. Staff 3 reported Staff 2 came over
and asked for Staff 3 to help her take out the recycling and he
reported he did because he did not want to get in trouble since Staff
2 is a team lead. He reported he knew he left Staff 2 out of ratio
within the home for about fifteen minutes. Staff 3 reported at the time
they took out the recycling all the youth were sleeping in their room.
He reported himself and Staff 1 told Staff 2 that they would be out of
ratio, but she did not care.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
15, 2024. Supervisor reported the concern of Staff 2 asking Staff 1
and Staff 3 to be out of ratio to take out of the recycling. He reported
the time this occurred was when all the youth were already in their
rooms sleeping. Supervisor reported the ratio at night is one staff to
twelve youth which meant the staff would have been in ratio if one of
the staff stepped out. He also reported the other incidents where
Staff 2 left the home to help him he reported the home was still in
ratio because the Assistant Supervisor was in the home. Supervisor
reported staff sometimes get confused that he and the Assistant
Supervisor can count in as ratio when needed. He reported Staff 2 is
the team lead and oversees running the shift when she works.
Supervisor reported he sets up the schedule so there are always two
staff working in each house and the team lead is not counted in ratio
so if there is a situation where a staff is out of ratio the team lead can
be counted in where support is needed.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 15,
2024. Staff 4 reported the ratio at the facility is one staff to eight
8

youth during waking hours and one staff to twelve youth during
sleeping hours. He reported there has never been more than twelve
youth in a home at the facility. Staff 4 reported on March 8, 2024, he
was working with Staff 1 at one of the houses. He reported he
received a call from Staff 2 to come help with something and he told
her he could not leave the house as that would leave Staff 1 out of
ratio. Staff 4 reported she tried to tell him it would be only for a few
moments and refused to do so as he did not want Staff 1 to be out of
ratio. He reported there was another time when he brought youth
downstairs with Staff 2 to play games. Staff 4 reported she left him
out of ratio for ten to fifteen minutes and when he tried to address it
with her, she told him she was the lead worker, and it was fine.
Staff 7 was interviewed via phone on March 18, 2024. Staff 7
reported the ratio at the facility is one staff for every eight youth. He
reported on March 15, 2024 around 7pm, there was eleven youth in
the home with himself, Staff 2, and Staff 9. Staff 7 reported he
remained upstairs in the home with two of the boys and nine other
boys went downstairs with Staff 2 and Staff 9. He reported after a bit
of time, Staff 2 came up the stairs and sat down on her computer to
do some paperwork. Staff 7 reported after about ten or fifteen
minutes he asked Staff 2 who was downstairs with Staff 9. He stated
she reported Staff 9 was in ratio down there and Staff 7 responded
no she was not as she had nine youth downstairs with her. Staff 7
reported Staff 2 went back downstairs and asked him to not say
anything. He reported he has heard from other staff that Staff 2 has
asked them to be out ratio multiple times.
Staff 9 was interviewed via phone on March 20, 2024. Staff 9
reported she worked on March 15, 2024 with Staff 7. She stated on
that day she remembers she was going to take eight youth
downstairs to play video games and the three other boys were going
to stay upstairs with Staff 7. Staff 9 reported that nine boys ended up
wanting to come downstairs, so it was planned for Staff 2 to come
downstairs so they would be within ratio requirements. She reported
Staff 2 came over to be downstairs for a bit and she then went
upstairs for about ten minutes which left Staff 9 out of ratio. Staff 9
reported she did not know why Staff 2 left her, but it did occur.
Staff 5 and Staff 6 were separately interviewed face to face at
the facility on March 15, 2024. Staff 5 and Staff 6 reported the ratio
at the facility is one staff member to every eight youth. They reported
there are two staff working every shift as there are typically more
than eight youth living at the home at any given time. Staff 5 and
Staff 6 reported there is a team lead who works every shift and can
count in the ratio if a staff needs to cook dinner or if there is any other
time an extra person needs to step into the ratio. They both reported
they have never been out of ratio at the facility.
9

Staff 8 was interviewed via phone on March 18, 2024. Staff 8
reported ratio during the shift she works is one staff to eight youth
since the youth are awake. She reported she has never been out of
ratio or has been asked to step out of ratio.
Documentation Reviewed:
- Facility Policy Manual-Staff to Resident Ratio- The policy
stated there will be a minimum one staff for every eight youth
during normal awake hours. During residents’ normal sleeping
hours there will be one staff for every twelve youth.
- Video Footage from February 15, 2024 at House 1 from
10:30pm to 11:00pm- The video footage began at 10:30pm.
Staff 1 and Staff 3 were sitting at the table. Staff 1 was then
observed walking down each youth’s hallways briefly opening
a youth’s door. At 10:45pm, Staff 2 comes into the home and
starts collecting the trash and recycling. Staff 3 is seen
assisting Staff 2 in gathering the recycling and trash. Staff 2
and Staff 3 exit the home at 10:47pm and at 10:48pm Staff 3
returns into the home.
- Staff Schedule and Youth Count for February 15, 2024-
Within House 1 there was 10 youth in the home with Staff 1
and Staff 3 scheduled to work. Staff 2 was the Lead Worker of
the shift.
- Video Footage from March 15, 2024 at House 2 from
7:00pm to 8:30pm- The video footage begins with Staff 2,
Staff 7, and Staff 9 in the common area with 11 youth. At
7:14pm, ten youth line up to go downstairs with Staff 9, one
youth remained in the common area with Staff 7. Staff 2 went
to the staff office for a minute before going downstairs. At
7:18pm, Staff 2 returns upstairs and sits at the kitchen table
with Staff 7. At 7:24 pm, Staff 2 goes back downstairs. At 8:17
pm, Staff 9 and Staff 2 walk upstairs with the ten boys that
were originally in the downstairs part of the home. Staff 9 was
left out of ratio downstairs for 6 minutes.
- Staff Schedule and Youth Count for March 15, 2024-
Within House 2 there was 11 youth in the home with Staff 7
and Staff 9 scheduled to work. Staff 2 was the Lead Worker.
- Video Footage from February 21, 2024 at House 1 from
5:00pm to 5:30pm- The video footage begins with Staff 1,
Staff 2, and Staff 11 in the common area of House 1. At
5:04pm, Staff 11 left the home and left Staff 1 and Staff 2 in
10

the home. At 5:10pm, Staff 2 left the home, leaving Staff 1 just
in the home. At 5:13pm, Staff 11 returned to the home. Staff 1
was left out ratio for 3 minutes.
- Staff Schedule and Youth Count for February 21, 2024-
Within House 1 there was 9 youth in the home with Staff 1
and Staff 11 scheduled to work. Staff 2 was the Lead Worker
of the shift.
- Daily Shift Log for February 21, 2024- Daily Shift Log
indicated there was 9 youth within the home during the time of
5:00pm to 6:00pm. The document shows between 5:00pm to
5:30pm all 9 youth were within their bedrooms or bathrooms.
- Staff 2’s Human Resource File- On 03/7/2024, Supervisor
met with Staff 2 when she returned from vacation and there
was a discussion about the concern of ratio policy not being
followed. Staff 2 was given a verbal warning about ratio and
the next violation would be a written warning. Staff 2 is up to
date on all required trainings. She was trained about the
overall function of the program on 11/13/2023.
Analysis The facility is found to be in non-compliance as during interviews
and video review confirmed Staff 2 left Staff 9 out of ratio for nine
minutes on March 15, 2024 and Staff 1 was out of ratio for three
minutes on 02/21/2024.
Technical Assistance:
During the course of this investigation when reviewing video
footage, it was found that medication was locked in a medication
cart but not locked behind a closed door. Although, staff indicated
they are trained that the door should be closed and locked, the
agency’s policy does not reflect that. Technical assistance was
offered to update the policy for Health Care Services to reflect
what is being trained.
Conclusion Violation Established
11

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: A state investigation of the Samaritas Shelter in Grand Rapids substantiated two violations: a staff member falsified bed check times on daily logs, and the facility was out of state-mandated staff-to-youth ratio on multiple occasions, with a team lead directing or allowing these ratio breaches. The report concludes that Staff 2, the team lead, bears significant responsibility for the violations, having instructed staff to falsify documentation and having created or permitted multiple instances of being out of ratio.
